hint.text: If the base on both sides of the equation are equal, the exponents can be evaluated with each other.

solution.text:
\((-_{k}_)^{x+1} \times (-_{k}_)^4 = (-_{k}_)^7\)
\(\Rightarrow (-_{k}_)^{x+1+4} = (-_{k}_)^7 \qquad [a^m \times a^n = a^{m+n}]\)
\(\Rightarrow (-_{k}_)^{x+5} = (-_{k}_)^7\)
On both sides, powers have the same base, so their exponents must be equal. Therefore, \(x + 5 = 7\)
\(\Rightarrow x = 7 - 5 = 2\)
\(\Rightarrow x=2\)
